name: Idiopathic Mesenteric Panniculitis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain and unexplained weight loss
symptoms: unintentional weight loss (15 lbs in 2 months)
physical_findings: palpable abdominal mass in right lower quadrant

lab_results.CT abdomen: fat stranding and soft tissue density in mesentery

prognosis: Variable - may progress to retractile mesenteritis in 20% of cases
description: A rare inflammatory condition affecting the mesenteric fat tissue of unknown etiology, characterized by chronic inflammation, fat necrosis, and fibrosis. Often misdiagnosed as malignancy due to mass-like appearance.
risk_factors: history of abdominal trauma or surgery
